intro: Protasparagus spinescens, commonly known as the spiny asparagus, is a rare and unusual plant belonging to the Asparagaceae family. It is characterized by its woody, shrub-like structure and the presence of sharp, spiny leaves that serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine, bristly hairs. Protasparagus spinescens is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
